reasoning: Chronic kidney disease prevalence reported as ~8.5% globally (8,500 per 100k). CKD defined as GFR <60 mL/min/1.73m2 or evidence of kidney damage. Measured as prevalence (existing cases) rather than incidence, as CKD is a chronic progressive condition without discrete onset.
source: Eckardt KU et al. (2013). Evolving importance of kidney disease: from subspecialty to global health burden. Lancet. 382(9887):158-169
